attributes.action: Green list approval for EU countries with biggest immigration percentage in UK
attributes.additional_details:
An estimated 3.6 million EU born citizens have lived in the UK (2019) There is a minimum of 313,000 people that have arrived to the UK with intentions of staying a minimum of 12 months in 2020. 
Over 6% of British population isn’t able to see family for nearly 2 years. Most of them were unable to say last goodbye to family members. That’s why I’m kindly asking you to consider EU countries with low new coronavirus cases such as Poland to the green list as you did with a lot holiday destinations
attributes.background: Consider of adding on the green list countries with highest percentage of immigrants in order to allow them visit families and home.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want to see changes to which EU countries are on the green list for international travel, but we're not sure which countries you want to be added to the list, or what formula you want the Government to use to decide what countries to add.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Add Poland to the green list for international travel: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590080
